              Modal Patterns
              
            
          
        
        
        The basic modal is a simple modal with a short message.The message can be just informative or highly important. From a simple information to a warning.It might require a choice of the user, but doesn’t have to.Find the categorisation of the Basic modal at the Variants section.



        
        
        
          Anatomy

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

HeadingBodyActions (Centred Button Group)CloseOverlayVariantsInfo

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

DescriptionUsed to present information or feedback that requires user awareness but no immediate action.It doesn't include a dismissive action button (secondary CTA).Confirmation

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

DescriptionUsed when a user must explicitly confirm or cancel an action before proceeding. It presents a clear message about the consequences of the action.Always Includes two buttons:Primary CTA: Continue the actionSecondary CTA: Cancel the actionForm

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

DescriptionContains a form element or multiple requiring. It supports validation and may include additional guidance to help users complete the form successfully.Primary CTA: submitSecondary CTA: cancel the actionOn submit we will always make a request to the server.Choice

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

DescriptionProvides users with two distinct options where each action leads to a different outcome.Primary CTA: the action (expected to be) taken by most users.Secondary CTA: the action (expected to be) taken by less users.What is not a Basic modal

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

We are excluding modals with longer flow, basket behaviour, Assignment Previews (settings + tabs) and fullscreen modals from being part of 'Basic Modals'.These types of modals have more specific usecases and underlaying patterns which we will not force into a basic modal. Examples of these types in Portals and Fessor could be:Creating + assigning teamsMF basketMF Assignment PreviewsPortal Full screen modals (global teacher guides)Dismissing ModalClick Cancel secondary CTAClick X in the topPress Esc on a keyboardClick anywhere on the backdrop(overlay)Action Complete: Triggering an action if the action completes successfully, modal close automatically.Feedback in actions with server transaction

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

CTA StateStatePrimary ButtonSecondary ButtonIdleEnabled, default stylingEnabled, default stylingSubmittingDisabled (functionality only) Disabled (functionality + styling) SuccessKeeps Disabled (functionality only) Keeps Disabled (functionality + styling) Animated iconsWhile pending state show spinner, we must set a minimum of time in case the request is super fast, to avoid a flickering effect.After success request show checkmark for 3 secondsDismissing Modal blocked:When the server request has started the user can not dismiss the modal.ErrorsIf error while transition:Modal keeps openButtons come back to the state before triggering the actionError message between the body and the button group (Each Product Team decide the design for the error message)Scrolling

  

  
    
      
        
      
      
        
      
      
    
    
  








  
    
    
    
  

The content between the Button group and the close button scrolls, so the Button group and the close button are always visible for the userContent GuidelinesCTA Label Format for Form, Choice and Confirmation variations <Action verb> <context noun><Action verb>ImperativeFirst word first letter should be capitalAction verb from a list:PrimarySecondaryAfslutBekræftGemGå tilLog indOpretSletStartAnnullerKasserLukOpret (when choice modal)<context noun>First word first letter shouldn’t be capitalOptionalCTA for Info should be always:Primary CTAWith label: OkRelation CTA & Heading[Showing examples like in the proposal Suggestions Copy CTA Modals ] IconsFor widespread and basic actions like e.g. “save” and “delete”, where a global icon standard is established, an icon is put to the left of the label copy in the primary CTA.For our youngest users and those with cognitive challenges, it can be very helpful to support the CTA with an icon. If the technical setup allows it and there is differentiation between primary school users and the rest, an icon may optionally be included in the CTA.An icon CAN be applied even though there is no global icon standard established. It is not a must and should only be done if we can diffenciate between usertypes (eg. primaryscool vs. older students/teachers). Examples of this MUST be part of the UI documentation in the specific product and the designteam needs to showcase the split. AccessibilityScroll lock: While the modal is open, it prevents background content from scrolling. This ensures that users stay focused on the modal content and are not distracted by the page behind it.Focus lock: All keyboard focus is trapped within the modal when it’s open. Users cannot tab outside of the modal’s content. After the modal closes, focus automatically returns to whichever element was last focused before the modal opened.Keyboard: Press Esc to close the modalAria properties: add aria-modal="true" , to indicate the presence of a "modal" element to users of assistive technology, meaning navigation is limited to the area itself and the background (the ancestors and siblings of the modal) is hidden.Inert: Add Inert attribute on everything but the modal inert - HTML: HyperText Markup Language | MDN
